annotations.description: Optionally defines preferred Annotations to be applied to the VirtualMachineInstance

clock.description: Clock optionally defines preferences associated with the Clock attribute of a VirtualMachineInstance DomainSpec

preferredClockOffset.description: ClockOffset allows specifying the UTC offset or the timezone of the guest clock.

timezone.description:
Timezone sets the guest clock to the specified timezone.
Zone name follows the TZ environment variable format (e.g. 'America/New_York').

utc.description:
UTC sets the guest clock to UTC on each boot. If an offset is specified,
guest changes to the clock will be kept during reboots and are not reset.

offsetSeconds.description:
OffsetSeconds specifies an offset in seconds, relative to UTC. If set,
guest changes to the clock will be kept during reboots and not reset.

preferredTimer.description: Timer specifies whih timers are attached to the vmi.

hpet.description: HPET (High Precision Event Timer) - multiple timers with periodic interrupts.

present.description:
Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer.
Defaults to true.

tickPolicy.description:
TickPolicy determines what happens when QEMU misses a deadline for injecting a tick to the guest.
One of "delay", "catchup", "merge", "discard".

hyperv.description: Hyperv (Hypervclock) - lets guests read the host’s wall clock time (paravirtualized). For windows guests.

present.description:
Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer.
Defaults to true.

kvm.description: KVM 	(KVM clock) - lets guests read the host’s wall clock time (paravirtualized). For linux guests.

present.description:
Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer.
Defaults to true.

pit.description: PIT (Programmable Interval Timer) - a timer with periodic interrupts.

present.description:
Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer.
Defaults to true.

tickPolicy.description:
TickPolicy determines what happens when QEMU misses a deadline for injecting a tick to the guest.
One of "delay", "catchup", "discard".

rtc.description: RTC (Real Time Clock) - a continuously running timer with periodic interrupts.

present.description:
Enabled set to false makes sure that the machine type or a preset can't add the timer.
Defaults to true.

tickPolicy.description:
TickPolicy determines what happens when QEMU misses a deadline for injecting a tick to the guest.
One of "delay", "catchup".

track.description: Track the guest or the wall clock.

cpu.description: CPU optionally defines preferences associated with the CPU attribute of a VirtualMachineInstance DomainSpec

preferredCPUFeatures.description: PreferredCPUFeatures optionally defines a slice of preferred CPU features.

items.description: CPUFeature allows specifying a CPU feature.

policy.description:
Policy is the CPU feature attribute which can have the following attributes:
force    - The virtual CPU will claim the feature is supported regardless of it being supported by host CPU.
require  - Guest creation will fail unless the feature is supported by the host CPU or the hypervisor is able to emulate it.
optional - The feature will be supported by virtual CPU if and only if it is supported by host CPU.
disable  - The feature will not be supported by virtual CPU.
forbid   - Guest creation will fail if the feature is supported by host CPU.
Defaults to require

preferredCPUTopology.description: PreferredCPUTopology optionally defines the preferred guest visible CPU topology, defaults to PreferSockets.

across.description:
Across optionally defines how to spread vCPUs across the guest visible topology.
Default: SocketsCores

ratio.description:
Ratio optionally defines the ratio to spread vCPUs across the guest visible topology:


CoresThreads        - 1:2   - Controls the ratio of cores to threads. Only a ratio of 2 is currently accepted.
SocketsCores        - 1:N   - Controls the ratio of socket to cores.
SocketsCoresThreads - 1:N:2 - Controls the ratio of socket to cores. Each core providing 2 threads.


Default: 2
